As of a couple of days ago Vincent or somebody (could it be me?) has not
upgraded the sample to work with the latest dist. If you run the sample with
the previous dist then things should be ok. My suggestion : write your own
quick sample with

public boolean aMethod() {
	return true;
}

and build a test to assert the above.

run j2eeunit and it should pass.Your unit testing is complete. To make double
sure you can implement your get() so as to return an html page that print out
false or true depending on the result of aMethod(). Hit it with the browser and
voila you have done your functional test, I mean acceptance test.

cheers

-H

--- selena su <selena.su@...> wrote:
> Hi There:
>      I'm using J2EEE to test the sampleServlet.class provided
> "J2EEUnit.sourceforge.com" but it give me this error when i run the
> servlet. I have done all the neccessary J2EEUnit configuration !
>      Does anyone came across this problem while testing the
> sampleServlet ? The funny thing, i don't even have a abstract or
> interface class which i know this classes can't be instantiated !
> 
> Thanks,
> selena
